answers.answer: No, hiccups are very common! My first baby used to get them almost every single day once I was about 26 weeks or so! Just try no to worry yourself crazy! You are still prego and the baby needs ya! Let us know!

I know that hiccups are common and normal, I was wondering if she did have a defect where she couldn't swallow, would it be possible for her to get hiccups.  I am not sure what causes hiccups.  What do you think?

Actually, one of the known causes (keep in mind in many cases there is no known cause) is having GD. In my case, I had nothing to point to why I had it, I just did.Try not to stress yourself out. Just wait and see what the u/s shows.Andi
I don't think a defect would cause her to get hiccups! I think everything will be okay! And just remember, that is just ONE cause that could cause that condition! What is your next step to find out?
Thank you so much, I know I am probably worrying for nothing. (hopefully)  It just seems so long before my appointment for the level 2 ultrasound.  I am grasping at straws. Thanks again.
From what I understand you must be able to swallow to get the hiccups.  I was told babies in utero get the hiccups from swallowing amniotic fluid.Hope everything turns out ok!
I think that you have to be able to swallow in order to hiccup. Also, sometimes the cause of excess fluid remains unknown, and causes no problems.

hi all..i am expecting my 5th baby in 6mnths time..i had polyhydramnios with my 1st & 4th babies & both with no cause found-incidently these babies were both girls & had no probs with my 2 boys,dr said strange & didnt know why or if indeed anything to do with the genders,maybe coincidence but all was well when both born so try not to worry tho easier said i know

question: Hi, I have been diagnosed with polyhydramnios which is excess fluid in the uterus.  I also have gestational diabetes.  I don't go for my level 2 ultrasound until September 19.  The waiting is killing me.  One cause of polyhydramnios is a defect where the fetus cannot swallow.  I am 32 weeks pg.  Yesterday I noticed my baby had the hiccups for the first time.  Do you think if she could not swallow, she could get the hiccups?  Please help, any response would be greatly appreciated.
title: Polyhydramnios
